result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea hearing on November 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 11-01-2022.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brad Eliot Kriegel in court without counsel.  Defendant has not been able to reinstate his driver's license.  Defendant continues waiver of counsel.   Adjourned to allow further pretrial.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant waives right to attorney.  Pretrial held with DA.  $500 signature bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to reinstate his driver's license.
